column4: I have Windows XP installed on my computer, and I wanted Ubuntu as well. So naturally, I opted to install GRUB after installing Ubuntu, but when I restart my computer, I get a GRUB Error 21. Can somsone tell me what is going on?
you could manually install grub, but i'd just go ahead and install ubuntu again and this time choose to install grub while installing ubuntu
it respects your windows XP installation ust fine

I reinstalled Ubuntu 3 times, and from what I saw, it did install GRUB while it installed Ubuntu. And what do you mean that it respects my WinXP installation? Because I already had WinXP before I tried installing Ubuntu
i had windows xp on my system and the grub install during ubuntu install didnt give me any problems
Well, I wish it didn't give me any problems, but it is, it's "Error 21" and I have tried everything I can to fix it on my own.
did you google error 21?
this guy mentions it might have something to do with bios settings for hard drive autodetection http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-grub/2003-02/msg00082.html
although that post implys it being a grub config issue, not neccessarily an ubuntu issue
Well, I'll try anything at this point :P
Wait, so I have to configure my BIOS for GRUB? I'm not completely understanding this.
has grub ever worked on this machine before?
grub is a very low level program, your bios settings could be giving it problems
No
No, as in it has never been run on this machine before
then i'd suggest at least checking how your hard drives are detected.  Also, are these just plain IDE drives?
Yes, plain IDE
also, are you using a basic hard drive controller, not anything exotic like a Promise raid controller or anything like that
cool, then just check to make sure your drives are set to autodetect in your bios "Standard Setup" section
grub uses some autodetection code to find drives when it starts, certian bios configs may interfere with that
Alright, I'm going to try that right now, if it doesn't work, I'll be back. Thanks for helping me thus far :)
